page.title: 09YOUNG AND OLD
page.content: There are two playgroups, one in Askrigg and one in Bainbridge. This situation is duplicated by the primary schools, both of which are Church of England Voluntary Controlled Schools. Bainbridge School occupies premises built in 1964, but Askrigg occupies its original premises and is due to move into the Yorebridge Grammar School premises on the outskirts of the village. The nearest secondary school is at Leyburn, 13 miles away, to which the students travel by coach. ---------- The elderly play an active part in the life of the community. Bainbridge has an old people's home called High Hall and a sheltered housing development of flats and bungalows known as Sycamore Close. Askrigg has an 'Abbeyfield' house, a group of flats for elderly folk, with a resident warden.
